alert.note: Alert for Accomack; Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Northampton; Virginia Beach (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 09 at 6:02PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Maryland, northeast North Carolina and Virginia, including the following areas, in southeast Maryland, Dorchester, Inland Worcester, Maryland Beaches, Somerset and Wicomico. In northeast North Carolina, Camden, Eastern Currituck, Pasquotank and Western Currituck. In Virginia, Accomack, Chesapeake, Norfolk/Portsmouth, Northampton and Virginia Beach. * WHEN...Until Midnight EDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Showers and scattered thunderstorms are expected across the watch area early this evening. Additional rainfall amounts of up to 1 to 2 inches are likely across the watch area, with localized higher amounts possible in locations that receive multiple rounds of thunderstorms. The flooding threat will be exacerbated in locations that have received heavy rain over the past few days. This heavy rainfall may lead to rapid water rises in creeks and streams, in addition to urban and other flood-prone locations. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Accomack; Chesapeake; Norfolk, Portsmouth; Northampton; Virginia Beach
